<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mtext> NO</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub> <mrow> <mtext>Br</mtext></mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> NOBr</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub> <mi>K</mi> <mi>p</mi> </msub> <mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mtext>NOBr</mtext></mrow> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext></mrow> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>Br</mtext></mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mn>28</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaaeiiai aab6eacaqGpbGaaiikaiaadEgacaGGPaGaey4kaSIaaeOqaiaabkha daWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaGccaGGOaGaam4zaiaacMcacqWIehcGca aIYaGaaeiiaiaab6eacaqGpbGaaeOqaiaabkhacaGGOaGaam4zaiaa cMcacaaMf8UaaGzbVlaadUeadaWgaaWcbaGaamiCaaqabaGccqGH9a qpdaWcaaqaaiaacIcacaWGqbWaaSbaaSqaaiaab6eacaqGpbGaaeOq aiaabkhaaeqaaOGaaiykamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaaaOqaaiaacI cacaWGqbWaaSbaaSqaaiaab6eacaqGpbaabeaakiaacMcacaGGOaGa amiuamaaBaaaleaacaqGcbGaaeOCamaaBaaameaacaaIYaaabeaaaS qabaGccaGGPaaaaiabg2da9iaaikdacaaI4aaaaa@6589@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

Substance
 Initial Partial Pressure (torr)

<math alttext="N O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 10.

<math alttext="B r 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 2.0

<math alttext="N O B r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 80.

The system represented by the equation above is allowed to establish equilibrium. The initial pressures of the substances are given in the table. Which of the following explains what the system will do as it approaches equilibrium?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q equals the fraction 80 decimal point squared over 10 decimal point times 2.0, which is greater than K sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>80.</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>10.</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>2.0</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and equilibrium will be approached by producing <math alttext="N O B r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the forward reaction is faster than the reverse reaction.

<math alttext="Q equals the fraction 80 decimal point over 10 decimal point times 2.0 which is less than K sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>80.</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>10.</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>2.0</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and equilibrium will be approached by producing <math alttext="N O B r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the forward reaction is faster than the reverse reaction.

<math alttext="Q equals the fraction 80 decimal point squared over 10 decimal point squared times 2.0 which is less than K sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>80.</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>10.</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>2.0</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and equilibrium will be approached by consuming <math alttext="N O B r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the reverse reaction is faster than the forward reaction.

<math alttext="Q equals the fraction 80 decimal point squared over 10 decimal point squared times 2.0 which is greater than K sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>80.</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>10.</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>2.0</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and equilibrium will be approached by consuming <math alttext="N O B r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the reverse reaction is faster than the forward reaction.

content.answer: <math alttext="Q equals the fraction 80 decimal point squared over 10 decimal point squared times 2.0 which is greater than K sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>80.</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mn>10.</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mn>2.0</mn></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and equilibrium will be approached by consuming <math alttext="N O B r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOBr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the reverse reaction is faster than the forward reaction.

topic.text: 7.10: Reaction Quotient and Le Châtelier's Principle

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
